text: Perry State Park is a state park located in Jefferson County, near Ozawkie, Kansas, United States, northeast of Topeka. The state park features camping, a beach, hiking and a fishing and boating area. Perry State Park was established in 1968 after an agreement was made between the Kansas Parks and Resources and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. ==See also== * Perry Lake * List of Kansas state parks * List of lakes, reservoirs, and dams in Kansas * List of rivers of Kansas ==References== Category:State parks of Kansas Category:Protected areas of Jefferson County, Kansas Category:Protected areas established in 1968 Category:1968 establishments in Kansas
title: Perry State Park
